text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.

what: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
text: Create APA-formatted text results independent-samples t-test following format: paired-samples t-test conducted compare {dv} {level1} (M = {mean1}, SD = {sd1}) {level2} (M = {mean2}, SD = {sd2}). {non}significant difference; t({df}) = {t_value}, p = {p_value}.

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
code: apa_t_pair(x, y, dv = "the DV", level1 = "level 1", level2 = "level 2")

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
text: x vector values level 1. y vector values level 2. dv text describing DV output statement. level1 text describing level 1 output statement. level2 text describing level 2 output statement.

title: APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
APA text for Paired-Samples T-Test — apa_t_pair
code: # use generic text apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self,            y = self_res_att$f_non) #> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare the DV between level 1 (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and level 2 (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.  # specify the text for dv and levels apa_t_pair(x = self_res_att$f_self,            y = self_res_att$f_non,            dv = "preferences for female faces",            level1 = "participants who resembled those faces",            level2 = "non-self participants") #> A paired-samples t-test was conducted to compare preferences for female faces between participants who resembled those faces (M = 3.5, SD = 1.6) and non-self participants (M = 3.0, SD = 1.2). There was a significant difference; t(107) = 3.60, p = 0.000.
